thread.title: Taft tennis wins league matches

title: Taft tennis wins league matches
text: Taft tennis wins league matches Team defeats Cesar Chavez and Shafter Comment Taft Midway Driller - Taft, CA Writer Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 1:12 PM Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 1:12 PM The Taft High varsity girls’ tennis team went on the road to shut out two league opponents this week, Cesar Chavez on Tuesday and Shafter on Wednesday. At Shafter Wednesday, in a battle of juniors, Kelsey Rushing beat Jasmine Lomeli, 6-3, 6-0. Dariana Calderon beat Erendira Rivera, 6-4, 6-1. In the only close match, sophomore Zayn Herrera bounced back from a slow start to beat the steady senior, Karen Gutierrez, 2-6, 6-0, 10-7. Leighton May beat Emily Luna, 6-4, 6-2. Brisa Guizar beat Brianna Contreres, 6-0, 6-2. And, Yuvia Woggn was the first one of the court with a 6-1, 6-3 win over Rebecca Bernal. In doubles Rushing and Calderon beat Lomeli and Rivera, 6-1, 6-2. May and Guizar beat Luna and Seraphi Lopez, 6-0, 6-4. And, sisters Elizabeth and Diana Huizar blanked Bernal and Sarah Reyna, 6-0, 6-0. At Chavez the day before the score was the same, 9-0, but the matches were closer. Anneca Taylor beat Raj Batth, 6-1, 6-1. Calderon beat Cassie Cabading, 6-3, 6-0. Herrera beat Kimberly Hernandez, 6-3, 6-1. May beat Jeanette Arellano, 6-1, 6-4. And Woggn beat Shamarie Dzamesi, 6-2, 3-6, 10-5. In doubles, Taylor and Calderon dispatched Hernandez and Arellano, 6-2, 6-3. May and Guizar outlasted Perez and Dzamesi, 6-2, 4-6, 10-6. And, the Huizar sisters beat Marelalo Cortez and Kimberly Vega, 6-2, 6-2. Taft improved to 12-4 overall; 8-2 in the South Sequoia League. Chavez dropped to 2-9 overall; 2-6 in the SSL. Shafter’s record was not available. In the JV matches, Taft shut out Chavez, 9-0, but fell to Shafter 5-4. Hosting Shafter, Taft No. 1 Cielo Woggn, lost 6-2, 6-1. Rosa Silva won 6-3, 5-7, 10-6. Alondra Cisneros won 6-0, 6-2. Brenda Santiago lost 6-4, 6-1, Brenda Ambriz lost 6-4, 6-2. Erina Tuaila came from behind to win, 3-6, 6-2, 11-9. In doubles, Silva and Cisneros won, 6-0, 3-6, 10-5. Santiago and Ambriz lost in a third-set tiebreaker. And, freshmen Chloe McAfee and Carla Casillas lost 6-2, 6-4. In the home match against Chavez,C. Woggn held on to win 6-2, 4-6, 10-7. Silva won 6-4, 6-4, Cisneros won 6-3, 7-5. Santiago won 6-3, 7-6 (7-5). Ambriz won 6-2, 6-2. And Tuaila won 6-2, 6-0. In doubles, Silva and Santiago won 6-2, 6-2. In a seesaw match, Cisneros and Tuaila prevailed 6-1, 0-6, 10-5. And, McAfee and Casillas won 6-4, 6-0. Taft’s JV record is 8-10 overall; 6-3 in the SSL. Next week, Taft’s varsity travels to Wasco on Tuesday, Oct. 6, and hosts Robert F. Kennedy on Thursday, Oct. 8. Taft’s JV is away at Wasco, but also home on Thursday. Taft Midway Driller - Taft, CA Writer
